title: Schnorr Proof
description: A non-interactive zero-knowledge proof of knowledge of a private key `s` corresponding to a public key `h`.

commitment.description: The one-use public key `k = g ≥` generated from the random one-use private key `r`. This acts as a committment to `r`.

challenge.description: The challenge `c` that is produced by hashing relevent parameters, including the original public key `h` and the one-time public key `k`.

response.description: The response `u = r + c s mod (p - 1)` to the challenge, where `r` is the one-time private key corresponding to the one-time public key `k`, and `s` is the private-key corresponding to the original public key `h`.
